intro: Cerbera cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cerbera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that are often followed by orange-red berries. It is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
